body.p: A store asked 250 of its customers whether or not they were satisfied with the service. The purpose of this study was to examine the relationship between the customer's satisfaction and gender.
This study is an example of which role-type classification?

response.feedback: Not quite right. We are examining how gender affects satisfaction. You are correct that the explanatory variable, gender, is categorical. Is the response variable categorical or quantitative?
Correct. Both the explanatory (gender) and response (satisfaction) variables are categorical in this case. Therefore, this is an example of case C→C.
Incorrect. We are examining how gender affects satisfaction. Decide which is the explanatory variable and which is the response variable. Then decide whether each is categorical or quantitative.
Not quite right. We are examining how gender affects satisfaction. You are correct that the response variable, satisfaction, is categorical. Is the explanatory variable categorical or quantitative?

part.hint: The two relevant variables here are gender (male or female) and satisfaction (yes or no). Determine the role-type classification for these two variables.
